newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan land prices down 8.3% in 1996 -- govt agency.
newsitem.headline: Japan land prices down 8.3% in 1996 -- govt agency.

text.p: The average price of land in Japan as of January 1 this year was 8.3 percent lower than a year earlier, the fifth consecutive annual drop, the National Tax Administration said on Monday.
The agency said the price of one square metre (yard) of land in built-up areas stood at an average of 176,000 yen nationwide in 1996, down from 192,000 yen a year earlier.
In 1995, the average land price fell 13.5 percent.
By region, the price of land in Tokyo dropped 11.0 percent to an average 584,000 yen a square metre.
Land prices fell by 9.5 percent in Osaka, western Japan, to 352,000 yen a square metre and by 10.6 percent in Chiba Prefecture, near Tokyo, to 193,000 yen.
The average price in central Tokyo was 747,000 yen, down 12.1 percent.
The most expensive piece of land was located in Tokyo's Ginza shopping area, priced at 11.36 million yen for a square metre, down 5.3 percent from a year earlier.
